<p style="color:darkred; font-weight: bold;  text-align: left"> Please note this inconvenient requirement when using "data cleaning" capabilities: </h5>
There are steps in the analysis that only work if specific phrases can be located in the file name (unique to each experimental trial). Therefore, the name of the file matters. A specific and consitent naming of the files is best implemented at the time of experimental data collection. Important notes:

- The "box" correspond to a Firesting oxygen meter box, in this context
- It is assumed, that these boxes are numbered
- It is assumed that the following parts are present in the filename: 
  * box# : where the # is numeric, e.g. box1, box3 (case-insesitive)
  * date : date in the following format; '3-letter month + 2 number-date", e.g. jun10, may01
  * year is included

  A full example:
